column4: I have a 37gb Hard drive formatted as ext3.  It has only 12gb of files on it but reports that it only has 5.6gb free. How can I correct that?
ï»¿I have a 37gb Hard drive formatted as ext3.  It has only 12gb of files on it but reports that it only has 5.6gb free. How can I correct that?
how are you determining those numbers?
does it say "some contents unreadable" under the number that tells you how much is used?
I got those numbers by right clicking on the icon for the drive as its mounted on teh desktop and selecting properties
let me see
nope, doesnt say that
pastebin the output of 'df -h'
how do i use pastebin?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/57944/
says 27G used there
yeah, i see that. its different if i select its properties from the desktop or if I highlight the files and choose properties from within the drive
what if you do: du -sh /media/disk
27G /media/disk
could there be hidden files in there taking up room?
yes, that's a possibility
ill just make it easy and copy the 12gigs I have in the only folder there onto the 1st hard drive. then reformat the 2nd before copying them back.  should work right?
you want to just keep those 12G?  Did you delete stuff from the drive?  It goes into the trash when you do that
i do have stuff in the trash,  never really thought about that taking up room on the drive but i suppose it would... let me empty the trash and look again
emptying the trash did the trick.  boy i feel dumb now... lol
Thanks for your help jrib!  Have a nice day. :)
no problem.  You too
